messages.message: what is the expected behavior for ai runtime in deployments? currently it looks like the ai runtime version is not being passed as part of the runtime config in a deployment run, meaning it defaults to the latest version but also displays as the first version (1.0.0) (aihub support thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1746439068562849)). should deployment runs match w/ app runs in terms of updating to the next version if a version is expired or if the deployed solution is using auto update?

wouldn't it be tied directly to the app version that the deployment points to? There's no selector for it in Deployments and I don't think there should be a way to choose an AI runtime that's different from the one associated to the app version.

oh yeah i don't mean choosing a runtime version, just wanna make sure that deployment runs and app runs have the same behavior so exactly that. in an app run before the flow executes if we see that an ai version is expired and the mode is set to update on expired, there's a bunch of logic that happens to set the ai runtime to next unexpired version, but that is currently not being done on a deployment run. (acc the app release version is not being added as part of the flow settings at all in a deployment  run rn!)
so, does this mean that for deployment runs, AI Runtime settings for an app version have no effect today?
yeah basically, it means deployment runs are being run w/ the latest ai version always
okay, yeah that's a big problem....any sense of the level of effort to fix that?
idt the effort is high, the logic that's used to pull the ai version + update if needed during an app run just needs to be added to a deployment run
i'd say maybe 2 days including testing

perfect, thanks! yeah since we're essentially asking 100% of our customers to use deployments for production runs, this issue means no customers would receive the benefit until its fixed (& may have mismatched expectations, leading to an issue). I'd advocate to pull this in as soon as possible, unless there's an active :fire: elsewhere (such as the fanny mae issues).
100% we need to do this asap - the deployment should leverage the specific AI runtime attached to the app version included in the deployment
And all of the updating functionality should be exactly the same for an app run as well
I'm actually going to bump this to a blocker - since this is a significant break in the ai runtime functionality
